newsitem.title: UK: Berisford set for buy-back - paper.
newsitem.headline: Berisford set for buy-back - paper.

text.p: British consumer food equipment to home-improvement group Berisford International Plc is poised to announce details of its planned loan stock buy-back after the withdrawl of its would-be bidder, the Financial Times (FT) said on Tuesday.

The Magnet kitchens and Welbit kitchen equipment group is expected to spend up to 70 million stg of its 113 million cash pile buying back part of its five percent convertible unsecured loan stock, the FT said.
According to Charles Pick, analyst at brokers Panmure Gordon, the buy-back could reduce the company's fully-diluted equity by about 15 percent, lifting earnings per share, the FT said.
The possible buy-back comes on the heels of news on Monday that a possible bid approach for the company, drawn to shareholders' attention last week, had come to nothing and would not progress.
"We are pleased that the period of uncertainty created by the expression of interest has now ended," Berisford chairman John Sclater said in a statement on Monday.
"This allows us to get on with our loan stock buy-back programme."
